Using Carousel¶

Carousel gives biologists point-and-click access to open source data visualization tools

Create an account¶

  • In the current phase of beta testing, accounts are available [by request](mailto:hutchdatacore@fredhutch.org).

  • In the next phase, accounts will be made available to all Fred Hutch users.

## Log In

Use your Carousel username and password to securely access your account. ![login page](/assets/images/using_carousel/login.png)

After logging in, you will see a list of the datasets which you have uploaded, or which have been shared with you by another user. ![main page](/assets/images/using_carousel/main_page.png)

## Browse the apps

Take a look through the [list of available applications](/docs/apps/) and find one which may be useful for you and your data.

If you have any suggestions for additional apps, please [let us know](mailto:hutchdatacore@fredhutch.org).

![app page](/assets/images/using_carousel/apps.png)

## Upload your data

Each app in Carousel comes with a description of what files are required. For the example of JBrowse2 (below), a dataset must contain a genome assembly file (in FASTA format) as well as one or more tracks, which may be aligned reads (in BAM format), called varients (VCF), or other continuous data (BigWig/BigBed).

To upload each of these data files, either select a file from your local computer or provide a URL from which it can be downloaded. If your data is located in object storage (such as AWS S3) a [presigned URL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/ShareObjectPreSignedURL.html) may be generated to easily import into Carousel.

![dataset upload page](/assets/images/using_carousel/upload.png)

After the upload is complete, the overview page shows a table confirming the list of files that were uploaded.

![complete upload page](/assets/images/using_carousel/upload_2.png)

## Launch your dataset

After uploading your dataset, you will see it appear in your list of available datasets.

![main page with new dataset](/assets/images/using_carousel/main_page_w_new_dataset.png)

To launch the dataset, click the blue power button on the left.

![dataset starting full screen photo](/assets/images/using_carousel/dataset_starting_full_screen.png)

Once your dataset is running (which may take a few minutes) a blue “Dataset Running” badge will appear near the top of the page.

![main page with blue dataset running badge in upper right corner](/assets/images/using_carousel/dataset_running_full_screen.png)

## Interact with your data!

Once the datset is running, click on the green “Maximize” button to view the visualization. To go back to your list of datasets, click on the “Minimize” button. To close the dataset completely, click on the red “Close” button.

![screenshot of jbrowse2 application running in carousel](/assets/images/using_carousel/running_jbrowse.png)

## Edit and share your dataset

To edit or share your dataset, click on the “Edit” icon on the right side of the dataset list. The resulting menu provides options for:

  • Sharing the dataset with specific collaborators

  • Adding metadata tags to help organize your datasets

  • Deleting your dataset

![edit page](/assets/images/using_carousel/edit_dataset.png)

Metadata tags are displayed alongside your dataset on the main page. You can use the menus at the top of the page to filter the dataset list using those tags.

![main page with tags showing](/assets/images/using_carousel/main_page_tags.png)

## Account settings

In the Account menu, you can change the password associated with your Carousel account.

![Account settings page](/assets/images/using_carousel/account.png)
